titleStmt.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1827 Oct. 18-19 : a machine readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text. For all other use contact the Tennessee State Library and Archives, 403 Seventh Avenue North, Nashville, TN 37243-0312. (615) 741-2764.

bibl.title: [Entries from the Cherokee Supreme Court Docket, 1823-1834, New Echota] 1827 Oct. 18-19
bibl.note: This is an excerpt from the Cherokee Supreme Court docket for the years 1823 to 1834. The Cherokee Supreme Court convened annually in New Echota beginning on the second Monday in October and lasting three weeks. This excerpt contains the both the October 18 and 19, 1827 court summaries. Entries from this Supreme Court docket cover items ch100-ch163.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div1.head: October & November Term 1827
Wednesday 18th
div1.p: The court met according to adjournment-

Recd. of the Supreme Court, an Execution against Elyids Hicks where the Cherokee Nation is plaintiff for One hundred dollars principal and six dollars Cost of appeal 18th Oct. 1827
George Hicks
Marl. C. D-
The Courts find for the plaintiff sixty dollars with Costs of suit
Cost of appeal a--- $3_60 Recd. 19th Oct. 1827 of the Defendant three dollars & sixty cents in full of the recd. due the above nation in the above case.

div1.head: Friday 19th
div1.p: Court met according to adjournment Present
